channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: I kind of like that @AOC torched @elonmusk and he came back with a somewhat sexy oneline response and she came back with a joke, that seems kind of nice.

Ideally we should all be able to have our own TWTRs, just for our news and friends, even if we don't have $54 billion. The more I get pwned by billionaires the more I want to get away from them. I don't know if they're nasty on purpose, but they sure are pricks.
For example, Musk's old business partner, Peter Thiel, didn't like something Gawker wrote about him, so he hired a bunch of lawyers to file suits against them on behalf of people not as rich as he is, the goal being to drive Gawker out of business.
It worked.
I'm sure Thiel would defend himself saying he has the right to do it, and in America he certainly does. Billionaires have the right to shut down speech they don't like.
When billionaires are pricks and they own all the media, then we already live in an autocracy.
Removing the last vestiges of pretense of democracy is just formality. We already live in their playground, and we're okay as long as we entertain them, but as soon as we become inconvenient, as in Gawker for Thiel, well you are also free to go out of business.
Thank god we have prickish billionaires to protect our freedoms.
Maybe at the next meeting of the Billionaires Club they should ask Thiel and Musk to cool it, because they're letting the secret out about freedom.
We are subject to their freedom.
That's the new Constitution.

@berzerkeley the bird is horny

@bruces People used to assume you have to make money from a blog, which is ridiculous. My blog did make me money but only incidentally, by making products of mine more famous, or helping establish standards that allowed me to build other products.
43 Things was a social networking service established as an online goal setting community. https://t.co/D01zIcjAHW

That's something I can get behind, except I have no idea what right and left mean and I don't see any value to trying to define it. There are a bunch of assholes running around, they are trying to help themselves, and aren't concerned with anything else. https://t.co/EPoIEIjzFY

How much does MSNBC warn you about who their owners are? They are outspoken about Murdoch, that's for sure. They have an opinion about Elon Musk running Twitter. Are they sure there aren't any oligarchs in their management hierarchy? https://t.co/ixjvGJrvJB
We already live in an autocracy. https://t.co/ixjvGJrvJB
